Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fluorescence Angiography in Colorectal Surgery

Intervention.evidence: Studies comparing fluorescence angiography with standard care were included.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to assess the impact of fluorescence angiography on anastomotic leak and postoperative morbidity.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of anastomotic leak, assessed within 30 to 90 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were not detailed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding of outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians was not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Fluorescence angiography significantly reduced anastomotic leak rates, with an odds ratio of 0.64 (95% CI: 0.39–0.98, p < 0.0001)
